info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 2:31PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lawrence, southwestern Crawford, southern Jasper, Richland and east central Clay Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 230 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Olney, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Olney, Dundas and West Liberty around 240 PM CDT. Claremont around 245 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Sumner, Chauncey and Hardinville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
